now proceed to detail. I must 
however first premise that 
some of the principal air-
bubbles which I described 
in my former communication 
near the top of the mercurial 
column in the Society’s 
Instrument have passed up 
into the <u>vacuum<\u> as I have 
ascertained by circular 
marks which I made upon the 
exterior of the tube from which 
they have gradually moved 
away.
My Mountain Barometer agreed 
exactly, with all corrections 
made with the Society’s Barometer 
When first it was completed 
and Mr Newman made another 
for his own use which was
